author: bzar
message:
Hi, a couple of questions/suggestions from an avid keyboard user:

- Is it possible to move between tabs using the keyboard? If not, I'd like this addition. Using the same controls as Konsole (shift-left/right) would be nice.

- Does the keyboard (letter keys) do anything when you're browsing the tab items using cursor keys? If not, could I suggest making hitting the letter keys either a) jump to the first item starting with that letter, b) filter the view, or c) count as typing to the search box?

Thanks for this nice piece of software :)

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Moving between tabs with the keyboard is possible with ctrl+pageup, ctrl+pagedown, but you can now set your own shortcuts.

Letter keys do nothing for now when browsing tab items. I had an intial version which would do c) (which is the same as b) in the case of Homerun) but that was painful to use because one naturally starts to want to use backspace to erase a character, then the arrow keys to move a text caret (which is not there) between the characters, which conflicts with using the arrow keys to move between items. This was also causing buggy behavior because the focused item could be filtered out as user was typing. I could not get it to work in a way I was satisfied with, so in the end I opted for adding a shortcut to focus the search box instead (ctrl+f or '/')

replies.author: bzar
replies.message: Thanks for the response! Both of these work for me :)
